com.esri.mo2.ui.lyt
Class PageLayout

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--javax.swing.JComponent
                    |
                    +--javax.swing.JScrollPane
                          |
                          +--com.esri.mo2.ui.lyt.PageLayout
All Implemented Interfaces:
Accessible, Canvas, ComponentListener, ElementContainer, EventListener, ImageObserver, Layout, MenuContainer, ScrollPaneConstants, Searchable, Selectable, Serializable
public class PageLayout
extends JScrollPane
implements ComponentListener, Layout

This is the main class for layout package. It extends from Swing's JScrollPane classs and contains an instance of JLayeredPane. The layout's rulers are located at JScrollPane's horizontal and vertical head views. The instance of JLayeredPane contains all the map elements which will be placed in the JLayeredPane's PALETTE_LAYER. In addtion to these map elements, there are other supporting components. The very bottom panel is the page panel which show users the printable page's extent.

All LayoutTool(s) and an internal drag frame will be placed at the DRAG_LAYER of the JLayeredPane and only one of tools will be visible at any given time.

The current design doesn't require any movement of components from one container to another. When an element is added into a group element, the only possible change is the position(depth) of the element, and a group element just contains a list of references to those grouped elements and those elements' references are removed from an internal managed list. When a group element is un-group, those element references will be added back to the element list. Since DragResizeElement(s) are placed on top of all elements, they are fully visible no matter where underling's element is located. It also provides extra exporting image APIs for convenience to users/developers who want to export the current Layout to a disk file as an image.

See Also:
Serialized Form

addElement

public SelectionSet addElement(Element element)
Description copied from interface: ElementContainer
Adds a graphic element at the top of the z-order and returns a SelectionSet that identifies this Element. The SelectionSet can subsequently be used to modify the current selection, if desired, by applying it to the current Selection via the getSelectionSet and/or the setSelectionSet methods

Specified by:
addElement in interface ElementContainer
Parameters:
element - the graphic element
Returns:
a SelectionSet identifying the element just added
See Also:
ElementContainer.addElement(Element element)

addElement

public SelectionSet addElement(Element element,
                               int zorder)
Description copied from interface: ElementContainer
Adds a graphic element with immediate z-order value specified. Z-order is a "hint" for where to place the Element in the z-order hierarchy and if <= 0 will be placed at the bottom of the z-order (will be drawn first). If zorder >= size() then the Element will be placed at the top of z-order, i.e. will be drawn last.

Specified by:
addElement in interface ElementContainer
Parameters:
element - the graphic element
zorder - the initial z-order of the Element
Returns:
a SelectionSet identifying the element just added
See Also:
ElementContainer.addElement(Element element, int zorder)
